name: Dar-us-Sakina
mission: DAR-US-SAKINA IS A 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO INCLUSION OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY OF HOUSTON. OUR PLATFORM IS A SAFE SPACE FOR PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. WE INSPIRE THE COMMUNITY TO ABANDON STIGMAS AND EMBRACE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WITH EMPATHY AND RESPECT. TOGETHER, WE ARE BETTER.
theoryOfChange: Dar-us-Sakina outlines its strategic framework through its Mission, Vision, and Values, and details its approach to impact measurement on its 'About Us' page and in its annual reports. The organization fulfills its mission through programming in three key service areas: education, support, and community awareness. Within this framework, they provide diverse opportunities for individuals with disabilities and their families. Their 'Our Impact' section on the website tracks specific metrics such as 478 special needs families registered, 358 caregivers enrolled in support groups, 108 special needs students in Islamic education, 9,660 hours of volunteer service, and 350 community members trained in disability awareness. An annual report further elaborates on their programs, goals (e.g., expanding their Teen Adult program), and the demographics they serve, including percentages for various disabilities.
zakatClaimEvidence: Zakat Program For special needs families in crisis, we are committed to providing comprehensive support through our Zakat Fund. (Source: https://storage.e.jimdo.com/file/7e8e10d3-e0b9-4f0c-8248-8160b88022d1/DUS%20Adult%20Day%20Program%20Letter%20.pdf)

all_citations.claim: The charity has a score of 93.0/100 and a program expense ratio of 72.2%.
Total revenue reached $540,354 with fundraising efficiency at $0.13 per $1 raised.
The mission is to provide inclusive opportunities for individuals with disabilities in the Houston Muslim community.
Programs include the Sakina Internship and adult education initiatives.
The organization focuses on empowering individuals and providing community services.
Metrics include students receiving Islamic education and community members trained in disability awareness.
The charity supports families through a Zakat Fund and provides disability awareness training.
Donation options include zakat-eligible giving methods.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a GMG score of 63/100, reflecting excellent financial health and strong alignment with religious community needs, though impact scores are tempered by the high-cost nature of specialized disability services.
areas_for_improvement: Moderate data confidence regarding long-term outcome metrics
High cost per beneficiary relative to broader social service benchmarks

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is rated at 28/50, indicating a high fit for Muslim donors seeking to support religious-cultural causes through zakat-eligible contributions [8][11]. The organization addresses an urgent need for disability awareness and inclusion within the faith community [6][10].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates moderate impact (35/50) by focusing on capacity building and direct education for special needs students [9][10]. While the program expense ratio is 72.2%, the cost per beneficiary is approximately $3,948, reflecting the intensive resources required for individualized disability support [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Dar-us-Sakina empowers individuals with disabilities in the Houston Muslim community through inclusive education and specialized support services.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 93.0/100
Strong liquidity with 15.9 months of working capital available
Efficient fundraising operations costing only $0.13 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Dar-us-Sakina provides essential services including the Sakina Sunday School and internship programs to foster independence and community integration for individuals with special needs [3][4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill religious obligations while supporting disability advocacy and capacity building [8][11].

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified outcome tracking and a documented theory of change, though rigorous external evaluations are not yet available.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Dar-us-Sakina creates impact by providing specialized Islamic education and vocational training to individuals with disabilities, reducing social isolation and increasing independence.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that specialized educational interventions are actually resulting in increased independence for students.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a 24.6% growth rate and expanding programs like the Adult Day Program, the charity can absorb additional capital to scale services.

strengths.detail: The organization holds an <cite id="1">overall score of 93.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, driven by a <cite id="1">72.2% score in Culture and Leadership</cite>.
Dar-us-Sakina maintains <cite id="1">15.9 months of working capital</cite>, providing a robust financial cushion for long-term program stability.
The charity demonstrates high efficiency, spending only <cite id="1">$0.04 to raise every $1</cite> in total contributions.

strengths_deep_dive: Dar-us-Sakina's organizational strength lies in its specialized program design and financial discipline. The charity reported a <cite id="2">72.2% program expense ratio</cite> in its most recent filings, indicating that all functional expenses are directed toward its core mission of disability support. Their <cite id="10">2024 impact data</cite> highlights successful community engagement, including <cite id="10">training community members in disability awareness</cite> and supporting families through a structured Zakat Fund. Furthermore, the organization has achieved a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 score in Leadership and Adaptability</cite> from third-party evaluators, signaling strong internal governance and strategic clarity.
rich_narrative.summary: Dar-us-Sakina is a Houston-based nonprofit dedicated to <cite id="3">empowering individuals with disabilities</cite> within the Muslim community through specialized educational and social services. The organization addresses a critical gap in community infrastructure by providing <cite id="5">inclusive opportunities for students with special needs</cite> who often face barriers to traditional religious and social participation. In 2023, the charity managed <cite id="2">$540,354 in total revenue</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.6%</cite>. Their operational model focuses on direct service delivery through initiatives like the <cite id="4">Sakina Sunday School and the Teen Adult Program (TAP)</cite>, which are designed to foster independence and community integration. The organization maintains <cite id="1">a 93/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting high standards of accountability and financial health. As a <cite id="11">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, Dar-us-Sakina allows donors to fulfill religious obligations while supporting <cite id="10">families through a dedicated Zakat Fund</cite> that provides financial assistance for specialized care and education.
